messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Spanking for us
messages.msgSnippet: What a beautiful post.  It takes such a tremendous amount of courage to admit our faults and seek a better way.  I well know that it is often easier to take
messages.messageBody:
What a beautiful post. It takes such a tremendous amount of courage to
admit our faults and seek a better way. I well know that it is often easier
to take the low road, the road well traveled. Those programmed thoughts and
reactions ARE so hard to get rid of. The best thing you could have done for
yourself and your children is admit your weaknesses and seek new ways. The
hard part is changing overnight. I've been there. I AM there. Blessings
to you and your family!

Jennifer

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Spanking for us
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 4/17/03 4:25:06 PM Eastern Daylight Time, unolist@aol.com ... what a wonderful post.  Congrats on recognizing areas that your family needs
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 4/17/03 4:25:06 PM Eastern Daylight Time, unolist@...
writes:

> The fact that my daughter somehow still trusts me, knows that I love her,
> and
> doesn't want to escape me and go to school is more than I can wrap my mind
> around. Our family is growing stronger every day, sometimes by trial, but
> we
> help each other get through it. Wow.
>
>

what a wonderful post. Congrats on recognizing areas that your family needs
work on. That is more work than most people ever put into their family. It
takes a lot to recognize you are wrong and admit it and work on it.
((((big hug)))) from me
Pam G.
